subject: Self Care
title: Environment Design
description: A short lesson to help you apply Environment Design.

hook.text: Put fruit on the counter and cookie jars in the cabinet. People eat what they see, not what they intend.

buildup.text: Your environment shapes behavior more than motivation. Visible cues trigger habits automatically.

discovery.text: James Clear calls this 'making it obvious.' Place cues for good habits in plain sight everywhere.

twist.text: The same principle works in reverse. Hide or remove cues for bad habits and they fade without willpower.

climax.text: Redesign your space: gym bag by the door, water bottle on the desk, phone in another room at night.

punchline.text: Design your environment. Don't fight your nature.

quiz.question: Why is environment design more effective than willpower?
options: Visible cues trigger habits automatically without mental effort
